metadata.Title: CVE-2016-1956 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Mozilla Firefox before 45.0 on Linux, when an Intel video driver is used, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (memory consumption or stack memory corruption) by triggering use of a WebGL shader.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-1956` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 45.0+build2-0ubuntu1
firefox-globalmenu - 45.0+build2-0ubuntu1
firefox-mozsymbols - 45.0+build2-0ubuntu1
firefox-testsuite - 45.0+build2-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '45.0+build2-0ubuntu1').
